msItem.title: Tarikh-i 'Alamara-yi 'Abbasi. Vol. II. Latter portion of the first part, A.H. 1015-6 to 1025; and the second part, completing the work / Written at he command of Mirza Buland-himmat .
msItem.note: First front flyleaf, recto: Presented by Sir John Malcolm May 19, 1827. The colophon at the end of Maqsad 1 gives the date 9 Muharram 1071, the final colophon 5 Muharram A.H.1091. Yet the hand is evidently the same throughout and the transition from Maqsad I to Maqsad II is in the middle of a gathering.
msItem.incipit: Nauruz-i in sal-i humayun-fal dar ruz-i chahrshanbah

condition.p: Some damage from worms and white ants.

bindingDesc.p: Red leather Oriental binding with stamped decoration and marbled doublures. Evidently by the same binder as Codrington/Reade No 143. The stamp used for the borders is identical.

availability.p: Visitors are welcome to consult manuscripts in the library by prior appointment. Information on access is available on the library page of the Society's web site at www.royalasiaticsociety.org and appointments can be arranged by e-mailing library@royalasiaticsociety.org

list.item: History of Iran, Safavid period, Shah 'Abbas I.
